message.content: When a vase is broken, its shape and mass are changed. This is because the vase goes from being one solid object to multiple pieces. The shape of the vase is altered as the pieces may no longer fit together as they did before. The mass of the vase is also changed because some pieces may be lost or broken off, reducing the overall mass of the vase. Option (A) is not applicable in this case because the center of gravity of an object is determined by the distribution of its mass, and breaking the vase does not change this. Option (C) is incorrect because breaking a vase does not chemically alter its composition. Option (D) is also incorrect as breaking a vase does not affect its speed.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the properties of objects and the effects of breaking. Breaking a vase would change its shape and mass. Option (A) is incorrect because the center of gravity is not directly affected by breaking the vase. Option (C) is incorrect because the chemical composition of the vase remains the same even when it is broken into pieces. Option (D) is unrelated to breaking a vase.

Option (C) is incorrect because breaking a vase does not alter its chemical composition. Option (D) is incorrect because breaking a vase does not affect its speed, as speed is a measure of how fast an object is moving, not a property of the object itself.
